title: Rageblade Needs a Nerf
body: Over the last seven games I've played this weekend I have noticed that Champions that carry Rageblades seem to be getting an absurd amount of kills.  It seems to me that this item has become fairly problematic especially on some Champions (Jax, Yi, J4, etc., heck I even saw a Diana with a Rageblade that roflstomped in team fights) I suspect maybe because of the new Masteries setups; unless someone else can explain why it's suddenly become so strong?  I know Rageblade hasn't exactly really been all that popular in awhile, and I suspect it's strong right now to try and get more people to use it, but there needs to be better balance here.  As it stands it is incredibly frustrating when you're against someone like Jax with a Rageblade and you have to focus them in team fights because they have a Rageblade and if you don't burst them down fast enough they're basically just going to solo your entire team, and that's exactly what they want you to do because it means the rest of their team gets to engage at leisure.  Once they get a Rageblade and a Guardian's Angel it's basically impossible to actually stop them from killing at least one member of your team.  As it stands Rageblade disincentivizes team fights (or just any straight up fights for that matter) because nobody other than those with Rageblades actually want to engage.  I'm not a big meta theorist, so I have no actual suggestions on how to better balance this item, I just feel that given my perceptions of it in the last several games I've played it has way too high an impact for a single item.

Anyway Rageblade is broken because it gives too many stats once you charge it. Like the stat value is over twice the actual price of the item itself

It's not just that, but also the fact that certain champions get waaaay too much out of using it. Look at Jax, Xin. Sated Devourer + Guinsoo's gives them so much power and they have zero problem getting their stacks up.
Melee champs get 2 stacks from their autos. Take that away and bring the stacks to like 10 and the abuse cases will really fall off because you actually have to work for the stacks.

The problem with the item, as it currently stands, is that it's too difficult to get the stacks for some champions and too easy for others. The melee champions who can get their 4 abuse the item, while the ranged champions who can't make it to 8 stacks with any reliability do not. Removing the double stacking might make it unusable all around.

Honestly, I think they need to rework the item entirely.

The biggest problem isn't on the toplaners that use it; it's on the AS-based hybrid junglers: Irelia, Yi, Jax, Xin Zhao, and Shyvana. Sated Devourer means that they can fully stack the item in three autoattacks.

I think that giving melee twice as many stacks as ranged isn't appropriate. Yes, melee has a harder time engaging and won't have the uptime of a ranged champion, but gap closers, slows, and roots exist for a reason.

IMO? Make it 6 stacks, with melee not getting any extra.

If you make it 6, it suffers from the same problems as before. Ranged take too long to benefit from the item, especially if its bought early. And melee will never get full stacks in a fight outside of laning. 

And it still takes 4 autos to stack. Sated only effects the on-hit damage after the stack, not the on-attack effect of stacking.
What if instead of stacking guinsoo's twice as quickly they just had more time before the stacks fell off?

But the primary buyers of Guinsoo's DO have gap closers. Xin, Irelia, Jax, etc. all have point and click dashes. Most of the immobile ones don't really care for Guinsoo's and would rather buy mixed offensive or straight tank items. Why would a Darius or a Garen buy Guinsoo's?

The most immobile champ that cares about the item I can think of is Udyr, and saying that Bear Stance isn't a strong catchup mechanism is disingenuous at best. I'd also argue he only buys it at the moment because it's incredibly strong - Devourer into Guinsoo's makes him relatively squishy, but he's saved by the fact that the item is so cheap.

At any rate, I don't think a 2500g item that essentially says "you can 1v1 anyone, go splitpush forever" is very interesting to have in the game.
